newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: BROKERAGE DEPARTMENT'S PRANK FAILS TO FOOL.
newsitem.headline: BROKERAGE DEPARTMENT'S PRANK FAILS TO FOOL.

text.p: Vilniaus Bank's brokerage department tried to pull a traditional April 1 prank which failed to fool Reuters' sharp Lithuanian journalists.
The brokerage house said in a statement that "the rate of the litas to the USD to be changed very soon."
"According to unofficial news that came straight from government sources...the decision to devalue the litas was taken," the brokerage house said in a statement.
The company confirmed that its "press release" was an April 1 prank.
The Lithuanian government and central bank are extremely sensitive about any talk about a possible litas' devaluation and probably would not be amused.
